title: [K-12] Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL)-Based Adult Mathematics Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts at elementary to middle school levels
context.additional_context: Offline Collaborative Learning Environments Supplemented by Smartphone-Based Social Media Tools, Designed for Participatory Learning and Peer Feedback

learning_goals: Learners can collaboratively design a mathematical modeling process to solve real-life problems.
Learners can improve problem-solving strategies through peer assessment using social media-based tools.
Learners can logically explain mathematical reasoning processes through three or more group discussions.

resources: Smartphone-based social media platforms (KakaoTalk Open Chat, etc.)
Offline math manipulatives (geoboards, measurement tools, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
